report.summary: Strange behavior when I unwatch the last episode seen.
report.label: bug
report.description: When I unwatch the last episode seen in a show, the next episode SeriesGuide tells me to watch is not the good one. (SeriesGuide version 7.2-beta1) Steps to reproduce the bug: Add a show (I'll take Family Guy for example as it has a lot of episodes). Let's say I have seen the whole season 1 and the first episode of season 2, so I flag them all as seen. Next episode SeriesGuide tells me to watch is now 2x02, as expected. I accidentally flag episode 2x02 as watched. I then flag episode 2x02 as not watched yet in the seasons section. Go back to the main screen (when you see all your shows), SeriesGuide now tells me that the next episode of Family Guy I have to see is : 11x04 (???) To go back to normal, go to the seasons section of the show, find season 11 and, with the action button on the right, flag all the episodes as "watched none". You can reproduce once again that bug by flagging the next episode to see as seen and flag that episode as not watched yet. SeriesGuide will always tell you that, with my example, the next episode to see is 11x04. Why 11x04? I don't know... Looks like that bug happens to the shows with multiple seasons (I can reproduce this problem with Simpsons show, Futurama or The Wire). I don't know if I was very clear with that bug, I'll provide a video if needed.
